scenarios.name: E2E - Successful Creation of Formula Metric with Weekly Cadence and Custom Target
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the complete happy path workflow: an admin logs in, invites and accepts a new user, creates a formula-based metric with a 'Weekly' cadence, adds it to the dashboard, and successfully configures a 4-level 'Custom' target.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the Application and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
Step 3: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
Step 4: Select the correct company from the list.
Step 5: Click on 'Administration' in the top navigation menu.
Step 6: Click on 'Manage Users' from the dropdown.
Step 7: Click the 'Invite Users' button.
Step 8: Enter the email address of the user to be invited.
Step 9: Set Admin privileges based on test data ('Yes').
Step 10: Click the button to send the invitation.
Step 11: Scroll to the 'Pending Invitations' section.
Step 12: Find the invited user in the 'Pending Invitations' table.
Step 13: Click the tick/checkmark symbol to accept the invitation for the user.
Step 14: Enter the first name from test data.
Step 15: Enter the last name from test data.
Step 16: Enter the password from test data.
Step 17: Click the 'Accept Invite' button to create the user account.
Step 18: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page via the navigation menu.
Step 19: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
Step 20: Enter the metric name.
Step 21: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 22: In the Formula Builder, search for and select the 'First Metric'.
Step 23: Click on the desired 'Operator' button.
Step 24: Search for and select the 'Second Metric'.
Step 25: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
Step 26: Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Step 27: Verify the 'Resets On' dropdown appears and select the specified day.
Step 28: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Step 29: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
Step 30: Navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
Step 31: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the modal.
Step 32: Locate the newly created metric in the left panel and click it to add it to the right panel.
Step 33: Click the 'Save' button in the modal to update the dashboard.
Step 34: Locate the correct metric card on the dashboard.
Step 35: Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
Step 36: Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown.
Step 37: Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
Step 38: On the Edit page, select the 'Target' tab.
Step 39: Select the 'Custom' radio button.
Step 40: Enter the 'Level 1', 'Level 2', 'Level 3', and 'Level 4' target values.
Step 41: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
Step 42: Verify the page navigates back to the dashboard and the metric card now displays the custom target indicators.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully logs in and selects the company.
A new user is successfully invited and the account is created.
A new metric is created using the Formula Builder with a 'Weekly' cadence.
The 'Resets On' field correctly appears and a day is selected.
The new metric is successfully added to the 'My Dashboard KPIs' section.
The 'Custom' target with 4 levels is successfully configured and saved.
The metric card on the dashboard is updated to visually represent the configured custom target.

scenarios.name: E2E - Successful Creation of Formula Metric with Time-Based Target
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the happy path for creating a formula-based metric, adding it to the dashboard, and successfully configuring a 'Time-Based' target with a start and end value.
user_journey: Step 1: User is logged in and on the 'My Dashboard' page.
Step 2: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page.
Step 3: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
Step 4: Enter the metric name.
Step 5: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 6: Use the Formula Builder to select a 'First Metric', an 'Operator', and a 'Second Metric'.
Step 7: Select 'Monthly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Step 8: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Step 9: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
Step 10: Navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
Step 11: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the modal.
Step 12: Find and click the new metric in the left panel to add it to the dashboard.
Step 13: Click 'Save' in the modal.
Step 14: Locate the correct metric card on the dashboard.
Step 15: Hover over the card and click the three-dot menu button.
Step 16: Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
Step 17: On the Edit page, select the 'Target' tab.
Step 18: Select the 'Time-Based' radio button.
Step 19: Verify the 'Start' and 'Target' input fields appear.
Step 20: Enter the 'Start Value' from test data.
Step 21: Enter the 'Target Value' from test data.
Step 22: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
Step 23: Verify the page navigates back to the dashboard.
Step 24: Verify the metric card now displays the time-based progress indicator, start value, and target value.
acceptance_criteria: A new metric is successfully created using the Formula Builder.
The new metric is successfully added to the 'My Dashboard KPIs' section.
The 'Time-Based' target option is selected and the correct input fields appear.
The 'Start Value' and 'Target Value' are entered and saved successfully.
The metric card on the dashboard is updated to visually represent the configured time-based target.

scenarios.name: Functional - Successful Creation of a Metric using 'Metric' as Value Source
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the happy path for creating a new metric where the 'Value Source' is another existing metric, not a formula.
user_journey: Step 1: User is logged in and navigates to the 'Metrics' page.
Step 2: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
Step 3: Enter the 'Metric Name' from test data.
Step 4: Locate the 'Value Source' dropdown and select 'Metric'.
Step 5: Verify the metric selection interface is now visible.
Step 6: Click on the metric search/dropdown field.
Step 7: Enter the name of the existing metric to use as a source.
Step 8: Click on the matching metric from the search results.
Step 9: Verify the selected metric is displayed.
Step 10: Select a 'Cadence' (e.g., 'Quarterly') from the dropdown.
Step 11: Click the 'Save' button.
Step 12: Verify a confirmation message appears and the new metric is listed on the Metrics page.
acceptance_criteria: The user can successfully select 'Metric' as the 'Value Source'.
The user can search for and select an existing metric as the source.
The new metric is successfully saved with the correct source metric and cadence.
The newly created metric appears in the list of all metrics.

scenarios.name: User Management - Successful Invitation and Acceptance of a New Admin User
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the happy path for an administrator inviting a new user, granting them admin privileges, and completing the account creation process.
user_journey: Step 1: An admin user is logged in and navigates to 'Administration' -> 'Manage Users'.
Step 2: Click the 'Invite Users' button.
Step 3: Enter the 'Invite User Email' in the email input field.
Step 4: Locate the 'Admin' checkbox and check it.
Step 5: Click the 'Send Invite' button.
Step 6: Verify the invitation modal closes.
Step 7: Scroll to the 'Pending Invitations' section and find the invited user's email.
Step 8: Click the tick/checkmark symbol in the Actions column for the invited user.
Step 9: Verify the 'Accept Invite' form is displayed.
Step 10: Enter the 'User First Name'.
Step 11: Enter the 'User Last Name'.
Step 12: Enter the 'User Password'.
Step 13: Click the 'Accept Invite' button.
Step 14: Verify a success message is displayed and the user is navigated to the dashboard.
acceptance_criteria: An invitation is successfully sent to the specified email address.
The 'Admin' privilege is correctly assigned to the invitation.
The pending invitation appears correctly in the 'Pending Invitations' table.
The invitation is successfully accepted by filling in the required user details.
The new user account is created successfully.

dependencies: A valid admin user account must exist to initiate the tests.
The test data must be correctly populated in the external Excel sheet.
For formula-based metrics, the source metrics ('First Metric', 'Second Metric') must already exist in the application.
For 'Metric' value source tests, the 'Metric to Select' must already exist in the application.
The application at the specified Base URL must be available and responsive.
